accessibility.title: Progressive enhancement
accessibility.description: Major functionality like main navigation and search should work without JavaScript enabled.

documentation.title: Enable / Disable JavaScript in Chrome Developer Tools

accessibility.title: Color contrast
accessibility.description: Color contrast should at least pass WCAG AA (AAA for mobile).

accessibility.title: H1
accessibility.description: All pages have an H1 which is not the title of the website.

accessibility.title: Headings
accessibility.description: Headings should be used properly and in the right order (H1 to H6).

video.title: Why headings and landmarks are so important -- A11ycasts #18

accessibility.title: Specific HTML5 input types (e.g. text, number, date) are used
accessibility.description: This is especially important for mobile devices that show customized keypads and widgets for different types.

documentation.title: Mobile Input Types

accessibility.title: Label
accessibility.description: A label is associated with each input form element. In case a label can't be displayed, use aria-label instead.

documentation.title: Using the aria-label attribute - MDN

accessibility.title: Accessibility standards testing
accessibility.description: Use the WAVE tool to test if your page respects the accessibility standards.

accessibility.title: Keyboard navigation
accessibility.description: Test your website using only your keyboard in a previsible order. All interactive elements are reachable and usable.

accessibility.title: Screen reader
accessibility.description: All pages were tested in two or more screen readers (such as JAWS, VoiceOver, and NVDA).

documentation.title: Screen Reader User Survey #7 Results - Primary Screen Reader

accessibility.title: Focus style
accessibility.description: If the focus is disabled, it is replaced by visible state in CSS.

css.title: Nesting and specificity
css.description: Component nesting is kept as low as possible (no more than 4).

css.title: Context vs component / element styles
css.description: Implementation styles are based on context, visual styles are based on component.
css.detail: Aesthetic changes should be modifiers on the root component (e.g. .c-button--rounded). Implementation/layout changes should be made on the parent component (e.g. .c-site-header { .c-button { float:right; } })

css.title: Content driven media queries
css.description: A media query should simply be added when the content could be better presented, not to suit a device.

css.title: Content agnostic class names
css.description: Component class names should not be tied to the content inside the component.
css.detail: For example using the the class name welcome_message would not be ideal. As that layout / component could be used elsewhere for other purposes a more appropriate class name would be message.

css.title: Avoid use of IDs
css.description: IDs have the highest specificity of any CSS selector and as a result they cause issue with overwriting styles in the cascade.

css.title: Unique ID
css.description: If IDs are used, they are unique to a page.

css.title: JS prefix
css.description: All classes (or id- used in JavaScript files) begin with js- and are not styled into the CSS files.

css.title: Embedded or inline CSS
css.description: Avoid at all cost embeding CSS in <style> tags or using inline CSS
css.detail: Only use for valid reasons (e.g. background-image for slider, critical CSS).

css.title: CSS Validator
css.description: The CSS was tested and pertinent errors were corrected.

css.title: Alpha tested at various breakpoints
css.description: All pages were alpha tested at several breakpoints.

css.title: Alpha tested on various browsers
css.description: All pages were tested on several browsers (Safari, Firefox, Chrome, Internet Explorer, EDGE...)

css.title: Print styles
css.description: A print stylesheet is provided and is correct on each page.

html.title: HTML5 Semantic Elements
html.description: HTML5 Semantic Elements are used appropriately (header, section, footer, main...).

html.title: Noopener
html.description: In case you are using external links with target="_blank", your link should have a rel="noopener" attribute to prevent tab nabbing. If you need to support older versions of Firefox, use rel="noopener noreferrer"

documentation.title: About rel=noopener

html.title: Clean up comments
html.description: Unnecessary code needs to be removed before sending the page to production.

html.title: W3C compliant
html.description: All pages need to be tested with the W3C validator to identify possible issues in the HTML code.

html.title: HTML Lint
html.description: I use tools to help me analyze any issues I could have on my HTML code.

html.title: Link checker
html.description: There are no broken links in my page, verify that you don't have any 404 error.

html.title: Adblockers test
html.description: Your website shows your content correctly with adblockers enabled
html.detail: (You can provide a message encouraging people to disable their adblocker)

images.title: Optimization
images.description: All images are optimized to be rendered in the browser. WebP format could be used for critical pages (like Homepage)

tools.title: Use ImageOptim to optimise your images for free.
Use Kraken.io awesome alternative for both png and jpg optimization. Up to 1mb per files on free plan.

images.title: Picture/Srcset
images.description: You use picture/srcset to provide the most appropriate image for the current viewport of the user.

documentation.title: How to Build Responsive Images with srcset

images.title: Retina
images.description: You provide layout images 2x or 3x, support retina display.

images.title: Sprite
images.description: Small images are in a sprite file (in the case of icons, they can be in an SVG sprite image).

images.title: Width and Height
images.description: Set width and height attributes on if the final rendered image size is known (can be omitted for CSS sizing).

images.title: Alternative text
images.description: All have an alternative text which describe the image visually.

documentation.title: Alt-texts: The Ultimate Guide

javascript.title: JavaScript Inline
javascript.description: You don't have any JavaScript code inline (mixed with your HTML code).

documentation.title: Guidelines for Developing Secure Applications Utilizing JavaScript

javascript.title: noscript tag
javascript.description: Use `<noscript>` tag in the HTML body if a script type on the page is unsupported or if scripting is currently turned off in the browser. This will be helpful in client-side rendering heavy apps such as React.js.

documentation.title: Quick Tip: Don’t Forget the “noscript” Element

javascript.title: ESLint
javascript.description: No errors are flagged by ESLint (based on your configuration or standards rules).

documentation.title: ESLint - The pluggable linting utility for JavaScript and JSX

performance.title: Page weight
performance.description: The weight of each page is between 0 and 500 KB.

documentation.title: Size Limit: Make the Web lighter

performance.title: Cookie size
performance.description: If you are using cookies be sure each cookie doesn't exceed 4096 bytes and your domain name doesn't have more than 20 cookies.

documentation.title: Cookie specification: RFC 6265
Cookies

performance.title: Third party components
performance.description: Third party iframes or components relying on external JS (like sharing buttons) are replaced by static components when possible, thus limiting calls to external APIs and keeping your users activity private.

seo.title: Headings logic
seo.description: Heading text helps to understand the content in the current page.

seo.title: Structured Data
seo.description: Pages using structured data are tested and are without errors. Structured data helps crawlers understand the content in the current page.
